intro: Labourdonnaisia sericea, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, silvery-white hairs on its leaves and stems, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Labourdonnaisia sericea is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
